newsitem.title: INDIA: India approves United International unit.
newsitem.headline: India approves United International unit.

text.p: The Indian government said on Thursday it approved a proposal by United International Holdings to invest between 2.6 billion and 3.5 billion rupees in a wholly-owned entertainment subsidiary in India.
The government said the proposal was among 69 foreign investment proposals approved by Industry Minister Murasoli Maran.
United International plans to invest between 2.6 billion and 3.5 billion rupees in the subsidiary over four to six years, it said.
The 69 proposals involved a total of some 11.3 billion rupees in foreign direct investment in India.
